meanings.definition: To cause harm or damage to.
meanings.sent1: Running in the hallway can endamages the floor.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to endamages the fragile vase.
meanings.sent3: Accidentally stepping on a banana peel can endamages your reputation.
meanings.sent4: His careless words endamages her feelings like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The storm's strong winds endamages the roof of the house.

meanings.sent1: The endamages to the car were extensive after the accident.
meanings.sent2: The flood left behind a trail of endamages to the crops.
meanings.sent3: The endamages to the painting were so severe that it had to be restored.
meanings.sent4: The endamages from the fire were visible on the charred walls.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake's endamages to the city were heartbreaking to witness.
